item.title: Visualizing mean values between two groups - the tidyverse way
item.description: A frequent job in data visualizing is to present summary statistics. In this post, I show one way to plot mean values between groups using the tidyverse approach in comparison to the mosaic way. library(tidyverse) data(mtcars) library(mosaic) library(knitr) library(sjmisc) library(sjPlot) Visualizing mean values between two groups First, let’s compute the mean hp for automatic cars (am == 0) vs. manual cars (am == 1). mtcars %>% group_by(am) %>% summarise(hp_am = mean(hp)) -> hp_am Now just hand over this data frame of summarized data to ggplot:

item.title: Error bars for interaction effects with nominal variables
item.description: Moderator effects (ie., interaction or synergy effects) are a topic of frequent interest in many sciences braches. A lot ink has been spilled over this topic (so did I, eg., here). However, in that post I did now show how to visualize error in case of nominal (categorical) independent variable, and categorical moderator.
